question_text: Which of the following are true about display resolution and its effect on visual quality? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Higher resolution means more pixels on screen
Higher resolution always means higher pixel density
Higher resolution improves detail in large displays
Higher resolution can require more powerful graphics hardware
correct_answer: Higher resolution means more pixels on screen
Higher resolution improves detail in large displays
Higher resolution can require more powerful graphics hardware
explanation: While higher resolution adds more pixels and visual detail, pixel density depends on screen size, and color accuracy is a separate metric.
